maml:description.maml:para: Gets the information about Bandwidth schedules

The Get-AzDataBoxEdgeBandwidthSchedule cmdlet gets information about Bandwidth Schedules. If you specify the Name of the Schedule along with the resource group name and Device name, this cmdlet gets information about that specific Bandwidth schedule

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzDataBoxEdgeBandwidthSchedule -ResourceGroupname resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name
Name DaysOfWeek RateInMbps StartTime StopTime ---- ---------- ---------- --------- -------- schedule-name Sunday,Saturday 0 13:00:00 14:00:00 Schedule-1 Tuesday,Friday 0 00:00:00 23:59:00 Schedule-2 Thursday 50 00:01:00 05:00:00

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Get-AzDataBoxEdgeBandwidthSchedule -ResourceGroupname resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name -Name Schedule-1
Name DaysOfWeek RateInMbps StartTime StopTime ---- ---------- ---------- --------- -------- Schedule-1 Sunday,Saturday 0 13:00:00 14:00:00

maml:description.maml:para: Get the available devices
The Get-AzDataBoxEdgeDevice cmdlet gets information about Devices. If you specify the Name of the Device along with the resource group name, this cmdlet gets information about that specific Device

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-AzDataBoxEdgeDevice Name ResourceGroupName DeviceType Location ---- ----------------- ---------- -------- device-name-1 DataBoxEdgeDevice resource-grp-1 eastus device-name-2 DataBoxEdgeDevice resource-grp-2 westus device-name-3 DataBoxEdgeDevice resource-grp-3 eastus

maml:description.maml:para: Get job by Name
This Get-AzDataBoxEdgeJob gets the active jobs for a device

maml:Description.maml:para: Resource Group Name of the Job
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Resource Group Name of the Job

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzDataBoxEdgeJob -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name -Name 1f2d8f1b-9104-49c3-b780-76db9abe7bd1 Name Device-Name status ------------------ ------------- ------- 1f2d8f1b-9104-49c3-b780-76db9abe7bd1 device-name Scheduled

maml:description.maml:para: Fetch the available roles for a device
This Get-AzDataBoxEdgeRole fetches the available IOT role by Name or lists the IOT roles available for the device

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzDataBoxEdgeRole -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name
Name IotEdgeDeviceId IotDeviceId IotEdgeDeviceId ResourceGroupName ---- --------------- ----------- --------------- ----------------- IotRole dbedge-edge dbedge-storagegateway iothub-dbedge.azure-devices.net dbedge-rg

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the creted shares for this device
The Get-AzDataBoxEdgeShare get the shares for the device. If Name is provided this will get the share by Name.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzDataBoxEdgeShare -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name Name Type DataPolicy DataFormat ResourceGroupName StorageAccountName ---------- ---------- ---------------- ---------------- --------------------- ------------------- share-1 SMB Cloud PageBlob resource-group-name storage-account-name share-2 SMB Cloud PageBlob resource-group-name storage-account-name share-3 SMB Cloud PageBlob resource-group-name storage-account-name share-4 SMB Cloud PageBlob resource-group-name storage-account-name

maml:description.maml:para: Get the Storage Account credential corresponding to device and storage account

The Get-AzDataBoxEdgeStirageAccountCredential will get the StprageAccountCredentail details. If you specify the Name of the StorageAccountCredential along with the resource group name and Device name, this cmdlet gets information about that specific Storage Account Credential

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Name of the storage account credential
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Name of the storage account credential
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Name of the storage account credential

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzDataBoxEdgeStorageAccountCredential -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name Name StorageAccount SslStatus ResourceGroupName -------------------------------- ---------------------- ---------- --------------------- storage-account-credential-name storage-account-name Enabled resource-group-name

maml:description.maml:para: Get the created users for this device
The Get-AzDataBoxEdgeUser will get the users for a device. If Name is provided along with ResourceGroupName and DeviceName, this will get the details by Name

Name of the user or Username

Name of the user or Username

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzDataBoxEdgeUser -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name Name ResourceGroupName -------- ----------------- usename resource-group-name

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Bandwidth schedule
The New-AzDataBoxEdgeDevice cmdlet will create configurations that will help in managing the Bandwidth usage by the device.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the resource group name
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Start time of the bandwidth schedule
Stop time of the bandwidth schedule
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the resource group name
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Start time of the bandwidth schedule
Stop time of the bandwidth schedule
Set Unlimited Bandwidth. If set to false will set default value as 20 Mbps
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Name of the resource group name
Start time of the bandwidth schedule
Stop time of the bandwidth schedule
Set Unlimited Bandwidth. If set to false will set default value as 20 Mbps
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzDataBoxEdgeBandwidthSchedule -Days Sunday, Tuesday, Saturday -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name -Name bandwidth-schedule -StartTime 11:00 -StopTime 12:00 -Bandwidth 30 Name DaysOfWeek RateInMbps StartTime StopTime ---- ---------- ---------- --------- -------- bandwidth-schedule Sunday, Tuesday, Saturday 30 11:00:00 12:00:00

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzDataBoxEdgeBandwidthSchedule -Days Sunday, Tuesday, Saturday -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name -Name bandwidth-schedule-unlimited -StartTime 11:00 -StopTime 12:00 -UnlimitedBandwidth Name DaysOfWeek RateInMbps StartTime StopTime ---------------- ---------------------- ----------- ----------- -------------------------- bandwidth-schedule-unlimited Sunday, Tuesday, Saturday 0 11:00:00 12:00:00

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Iot Role for the device
The Command New-AzDataBoxEdgeRole will create a new Iot Role for Edge device and Iot device

Encryption key of the Edge device
Please provide connection string of IOT Device
Please provide connection string of Edge Device
Provide the Platform, for ex: windows

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzDataBoxEdgeRole -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name -Name iot-role-name -DeviceProperties -IotDeviceId iot-device-id -IotDeviceAccessKey iot-device-access-key -IotEdgeDeviceId iot-edge-device-id -IotEdgeDeviceAccessKey iot-edge-device-access-key -IotHostHub iot-host-hub-url -EncryptionKey encryption-key -Platform windows -RoleStatus Enabled
Name ----------- iot-role-name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $AccessRights = @(@{"ClientId"="192.168.10.10";"AccessRight"="NoAccess"}, @{"ClientId"="192.168.10.11";"AccessRight"="ReadOnly"}) PS C:\> Set-AzDataBoxEdgeShare -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -ClientAccessRight $AccessRights Name Type DataPolicy DataFormat ResourceGroupName StorageAccountName ---------- ---------- ---------------- ---------------- --------------------- ------------------- share-2 NFS Cloud PageBlob resource-group-name storage-account-name ## $ClientAccessRights = @(@{"ClientId"="192.168.10.10";"AccessRight"="NoAccess"}, @{"ClientId"="192.168.10.11";"AccessRight"="ReadOnly"}) ## Possible values for AccessRight options are 'NoAccess', 'ReadOnly', 'ReadWrite'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $AccessRights = @(@{"Username"="user-name-1";"AccessRight"="Read"}, @{"Username"="user-name-2";"AccessRight"="Read"}, @{"Username"="user-name-3";"AccessRight"="Custom"}) PS C:\> Set-AzDataBoxEdgeShare -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -UserAccessRight $AccessRights Name Type DataPolicy DataFormat ResourceGroupName StorageAccountName ---------- ---------- ---------------- ---------------- --------------------- ------------------- share-1 SMB Cloud PageBlob resource-group-name storage-account-name ## $UserAccessRights = @(@{"Username"="user-name-1";"AccessRight"="Read"}, @{"Username"="user-name-2";"AccessRight"="Read"}, @{"Username"="user-name-3";"AccessRight"="Custom"}) ## Possible values for AccessRight are 'Change', 'Read', 'Custom'

maml:description.maml:para: Set the new password for the user
The Set-AzDataBoxEdgeUser will update the user with new password

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Encryption key of the Edge device
Password, provide as a secure string
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzDataBoxEdgeUser -ResourceGroupName resource-group-name -DeviceName device-name -Name username -Password @SecureString -EncryptionKey EncryptionKey
